required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial on Efficacy and Safety of Pritelivir Ointment for Treatment of Labial Herpes
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Multi-center, Three Arm (Pritelivir, Placebo and Zovirax®) Parallel Group, Comparative Trial to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Pritelivir 5% w/w Ointment for the Treatment of Recurrent Herpes Labialis in Adults - LipP1

brief_summary.textblock:
Randomized, double-blind, multi-center, three arm parallel group, comparative trial to assess pritelivir ointment safety and efficacy, ie, proportion of subjects with non-ulcerative lesions, in adult subjects with recurrent herpes labialis (RHL) in comparison with placebo or Zovirax® Cream. The start of treatment with trial medication will be initiated by the subject within one hour of noticing the first sign or symptom (eg, prodrome) of a recurrence of herpes labialis. Trial medication will be applied to the affected area 5 times daily for 4 days.
After self-initiation of treatment with trial medication subjects will be assessed daily by the Investigator until complete healing for a maximum of 13 days.
Subjects will document application of trial medication and the status of their lesion in a diary. There will also be blood sampling, ECG measurement and physical examination performed at the investigational site.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy Measured by Percentage of Subjects With Non-ulcerative Lesions Based on Principal Investigator's Assessment
primary_outcome.description: The Investigator assessed subjects for lesion stage at every visit as long as lesions were present from Visit 1 to the End of Trial Visit (Day 12± 1) as a maximum. Percentage of subjects with non-ulcerative lesions (i.e, scoring below 3) based on the Principal Investigators Assessment. Lesion stages were defined as follows: 1-Prodrome; 2a-Redness; 2b-Erythema-Redness; 3-Small Blister; 4-Ulcer; 5-Crust; 6-Drying up and healing; 0-Resolved

arm_group.description: Topical treatment (20 applications), 5 times daily for 4 days
Topical treatment (20 applications), 5 times daily for 4 days
Topical treatment (20 applications), 5 times daily for 4 days

clinical_study.keyword: HSV, pritelivir, herpes, herpes labialis, topical,

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients with labial HSV develop an outbreak only a few times per year. Therefore, more patients need to be enrolled to obtain the planned number of evaluable herpes labialis recurrences, as roughly 40% of subjects do not develop a recurrence. Overall, 362 subjects were enrolled and randomized. 223 started the self-initiated treatment due to an outbreak. The remaining 139 subjects did not have an outbreak and were not treated.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Institution and Investigator agree not to publish the results or other data of this Study without the prior written consent of Sponsor.
